definition: lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
snake/serpent/CL:條|条[tiao2]

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A kind word can attract even the snake from his nest.
sentences.chinese: 熱情的話甚至可以引蛇出洞。

sentences.english: The kind word can atract even the snake from his nest…
sentences.chinese: 好的言語甚至可以引蛇出洞。

definition: to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to prepare an ambush/to waylay
the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
pinyin: tang2 lang2 bu3 chan2 , huang2 que4 zai4 hou4

definition: lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
